topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce03b1636872048f8f0100#post_53ce03b1636872048f8f0100
>I ignored leading economists
No I speculated as to the cause and pointed out you were misinterpreting how wages work. I also pointed out that economists were divided.
So no.
I pretty much restricted my disagreement to "I doubt it's a good idea for states with a high surplus of unskilled labor, like Cali."

The fact is that they speculate raising the minimum wage is okay because employers are prepared to pay more for employees at this point because of increases in worker efficiency.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce03c263687204a4d50100#post_53ce03c263687204a4d50100
I said Stop that shit.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce04366368721e3a150000#post_53ce04366368721e3a150000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce03b1636872048f8f0100#post_53ce03b1636872048f8f0100
>I ignored leading economists
No I speculated as to the cause and pointed out you were misinterpreting how wages work. I also pointed out that economists were divided.
So no.

The fact is that they speculate raising the minimum wage is okay because employers are prepared to pay more for employees at this point because of increases in worker efficiency.[/bq]
Actually no; I was the one that said economists were divided on the impact of raising minimum wage, but that most economists agreed that the effect would be minimal and that raising over a period of time would be the best course of action to minimize potential risks.

You were the one saying that the effect on unemployment would be contested and kept going on about how unemployment statistics were wrong and how raising it in other states wouldn't work.

If you're going to argue that I'm wrong then don't steal my points I made; that's just a straight up dick move.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce04366368721e3a150000#post_53ce04366368721e3a150000
http://reason.com/archives/2014/03/03/9-reasons-why-raising-the-minimum-wage-i

Point Number 3 more than anything. The fact that they are willingly raising how much they pay employees show that the employees are adding more value than before.

New source:
http://online.wsj.com/articles/who-really-gets-the-minimum-wage-1404683348

Points out that the minimum wage argument banks on the increase in pay outstripping lost jobs. Which it has in the various states but those states tend to not have surplus workers and have booming economies (like San Fran the city)

http://www.theguardian.com/money/us-money-blog/2014/jun/03/thomas-piketty-seattle-minimum-wage-risks-jobs

Piketty only wants it to be raised so high, not quite living wage level with I believe you requested

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce04f16368721f43430000#post_53ce04f16368721f43430000
I posted the denverpost article saying they were divided. So I did too without prodding from you. Don't say I stole when you're lying about what I do 
http://www.denverpost.com/opinion/ci_25958267/low-wage-workers-continue-struggle-economists-remain-divided

And my reasons for saying that were sound as California already has high unemployment. 

I never said the statistics were wrong, I said there was probably something more going on and that attributing it to purely the minimum wage going up was foolish.
Especially when the argument by the economists who support it do so because they believe the benefits outweigh potential job loss as my sources point out.

Welcome to government 101: if you don't run a government based on risk vs reward and benefit vs detriment your government is going to fall apart pretty quick.

How have I ignored reality? You say I do a lot of things and my posting my sources have shown your earlier accusations to be erroneous. So why should anyone trust this assertion of yours?

Argue for once in your life. And no, going on an emotive tear about something that has nothing to do with what I said is not an argument.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce084f6368721f89740100#post_53ce084f6368721f89740100
[bq="Whatevs"]"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce07646368721e7def0000#post_53ce07646368721e7def0000
No. He's been invidious. He has lied about me. And he's only doing it to avoid the fact that I may have exposed a flaw in his thinking since he refuses to answer the question: were those discoveries made by Millenials?[/bq]
You're using that word wrong anyways.  Saying someone is being invidious would be like if they're insulting you or something.

You do realize that the LHC is run by countless scientists and technicians right?  The discovery of the higgs wasn't attributable to one generation alone.  That would be like claiming that cause one of the people that works on building a car is from Denver that all the people working on building the car must be from Denver.  For someone that constantly quotes rationalwiki you sure aren't rational.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ce097c6368721e9df50100#post_53ce097c6368721e9df50100
were any of the scientists millenial? How many? What of the other achievements you listed?
Because again, Millenials are too young to be very largely represented in my appraisal.

All of this because I saw the Greatest Generation as better than a generation that has largely been unproven and untested.
